item.title: 被债务淹没的世界中的量化宽松修正主义
item.description: 我是马尔科姆-斯科特，驻悉尼的国际经济编辑。今天我们关注财政紧张及其与央行政策的联系。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics editor in Sydney. Today we’re looking at fiscal strains and their links to central bank policies. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 美国航空公司亏损减少，机票收入上升
item.description: 美国航空集团公司（American Airlines Group Inc.【原文：American Airlines Group Inc. reported a smaller-than-expected loss, driven by a rebound in business and leisure travel in the domestic market.】

item.title: 通货膨胀率攀升，土耳其将关键利率下调 100 个基点
item.description: 土耳其央行连续第三次下调基准利率，但在通胀率意外攀升后，决策者放缓了宽松步伐。【原文：Turkey’s central bank lowered the benchmark rate for the third time in a row, but policymakers slowed the pace of easing after inflation unexpectedly climbed.】

item.title: Meta 投资者见证扎克伯格履行承诺，投入巨额人工智能资金
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）报道说，在 Meta 即将公布的季度财报中，该公司在人工智能方面的持续巨额支出可能会成为投资者关注的焦点。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner reports that Meta’s continued big spending for artificial intelligence is likely to be a focus of investors in the company’s coming quarterly earnings.】

item.title: T-Mobile 新增 100 万用户，得益于与美国蜂窝电话公司的交易
item.description: T-Mobile US Inc. 第三季度新增 100 万移动电话用户，并上调了今年的业绩展望，这主要得益于该公司最近收购了规模较小的竞争对手 US Cellular。【原文：T-Mobile US Inc. gained 1 million new mobile phone subscribers in the third quarter and raised its outlook for the year, buoyed by its recent acquisition of smaller competitor US Cellular.】

item.title: 关税重绘全球贸易版图，非洲吸引数十亿美元资金
item.description: 全球投资者正在重新审视非洲，而这一次，他们看中的不仅仅是深藏在地下的财富。【原文：Global investors are giving Africa a second look — and this time, it’s not just for the riches lying deep underground.】

item.title: 微软推动 Xbox 部门提高利润率
item.description:
管理层将游戏利润率设定为 30% 的目标导致了失业和项目取消

。【原文：

Management’s goal of 30% profit margins for gaming has led to job losses, canceled projects

】

item.title: Palantir 与 Lumen 签订超过 2 亿美元的协议
item.description: Palantir Technologies Inc.将通过新的合作关系向Lumen Technologies Inc.提供人工智能软件，这是电信公司支持更多人工智能服务的举措之一，也是Palantir争取更多客户的举措之一。【原文：Palantir Technologies Inc. will provide AI software to Lumen Technologies Inc. in a new partnership, part of a push by the telecom company to support more AI services, and a bid by Palantir to reach more customers.】

item.title: 交易大坝 "开始决堤，Blackstone 利润激增 48
item.description: 这家全球最大的另类资产管理公司发出了最强烈的信号：交易正在回归。【原文：The world’s largest alternative asset manager sent the strongest signal yet that dealmaking is coming back.】

item.title: 英国央行行长丁格拉称关税将打击经济增长并降低通胀率
item.description: 英国央行利率制定者斯瓦蒂-丁格拉（Swati Dhingra）表示，随着供应链的多样化程度降低，美国的关税将推动经济增长和通胀走低。【原文：Bank of England rate-setter Swati Dhingra said that US tariffs will drive growth and inflation lower as supply chains become less diverse.】

item.title: 散户交易者推动了动量股的剧烈波动
item.description:
黄金和加密货币也感受到了热钱人群的冲击。【原文：

Gold and crypto are also feeling the impact of the hot-money crowd.

】

item.title: 电力开发商 One Nuclear 将通过 SPAC 交易在美国上市
item.description: One Nuclear Energy LLC 已同意通过与一家空白支票公司合并的方式上市，这笔交易对这家核电站和天然气电站开发商的股权估值约为 10 亿美元。【原文：One Nuclear Energy LLC has agreed to go public through a merger with a blank-check company in a deal that valued the developer of nuclear and natural gas power plants at about $1 billion on an equity basis.】

item.title: 里斯本竞技史上最大规模债券销售募集资金 2.25 亿欧元
item.description: 里斯本竞技队在其迄今为止最大规模的债券销售中筹集了 2.25 亿欧元（2.61 亿美元）的资金，希望将其位于葡萄牙首都的足球场改造成一个现代化的娱乐中心，并偿还债务。【原文：Sporting Lisbon raised €225 million ($261 million) in its biggest bond sale yet, as it looks to turn its football stadium in the Portuguese capital into a modern entertainment hub and pay down debt.】

item.title: 英特尔面临盈利高门槛，股价飙升现金涌入
item.description: 在白宫、英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）和软银集团（Softbank Group Corp. ）的投资浪潮使英特尔公司的股价在不到三个月的时间里飙升了 86% 之后，投资者将把目光投向芯片制造商英特尔公司的第三季度财报的底线之外。【原文：Investors will be looking beyond the bottom line in chipmaker Intel Corp.’s third-quarter earnings after a wave of investments from the White House, Nvidia Corp. and Softbank Group Corp. sent the stock soaring 86% in less than three months.】

item.title: 日本 "铁娘子 "对投资者的意义
item.description:
市场预计佐佐江-高市将继续安倍晋三的一些政策，在安倍晋三的领导下，日元走软，而股市则扶摇直上。【原文：

Markets expect Sanae Takaichi to continue some of the policies of Shinzo Abe, under whom the yen weakened while equities rocketed.

】

item.title: CPI升温不太可能阻止降息，上证500指数反弹—目前如此
item.description: 由于市场对美联储下周降息预期的乐观情绪占主导地位，股票交易者很可能对周五消费者物价指数报告中任何顽固通胀的证据视而不见。【原文：Equities traders are likely to shrug off any evidence of stubborn inflation in Friday’s consumer price index report, as the market narrative is dominated by optimism for an expected Federal Reserve interest-rate cut next week.】

item.title: 挪威国家银行首席执行官称监管机构 "有权 "监控私人信贷
item.description: DNB Bank ASA 首席执行官 Kjerstin Braathen 表示，鉴于私人信贷市场的快速增长，监管部门对该资产类别的审查日益严格是件好事。【原文：Increasing regulatory scrutiny of the private credit market is a good thing given the asset class’s rapid growth, DNB Bank ASA Chief Executive Officer Kjerstin Braathen said.】

item.title: BC Partners 的新基金募集资金 18 亿欧元，首次关闭在即
item.description: 据知情人士透露，BC Partners 已为其新旗舰基金获得约 18 亿欧元（21 亿美元）的投资者承诺，该基金已接近首次关闭。【原文：BC Partners has secured investor commitments of about €1.8 billion ($2.1 billion) for its new flagship fund as it nears a first close, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 台湾芯片业对绿色能源供应表示担忧
item.description: 台湾的芯片制造商对政府提供新的绿色电力供应计划的可行性感到担忧，从而对满足能源安全关切的努力产生了怀疑。【原文：Taiwan’s chipmakers are worried about the feasibility of a government plan to deliver new green power supplies, casting doubt over efforts to satisfy energy security concerns.】

item.title: 瑞士联合银行首次 "软性政策 "利率总结令分析师意见分歧
item.description: 瑞士国家银行首次尝试提高其政策决定的透明度，这受到了寻求可能的降息和法郎干预线索的观察家们褒贬不一的欢迎。【原文：The Swiss National Bank’s first attempt to embrace more transparency over its policy decisions received a mixed welcome from observers seeking clues on possible interest-rate cuts and franc intervention.】

item.title: 中国在新发展规划中深化技术自力更生的努力
item.description: 中国发誓要在未来五年内实现技术自力更生和国内市场增长，因为中国希望使经济免受外国压力的影响，并建立一个可持续的增长引擎。【原文：China vowed to seek technological self-reliance and grow the domestic market in the next five years, as it looks to both insulate the economy from foreign pressures and build a sustainable engine for growth.】

item.title: 穆迪警告政治风险威胁土耳其经济收益
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）表示，政治紧张局势有可能使土耳其回归正统政策所带来的经济收益付之东流，并警告说，新的动荡可能会使投资者感到不安，并使货币政策复杂化。【原文：Political tensions risk undoing the economic gains from Turkey’s return to orthodox policies, Moody’s Ratings said, warning renewed unrest may rattle investors and complicate monetary policy.】

item.title: 默克尔前顾问称，是时候让德国人担任欧洲央行行长了
item.description: 据德国总理安格拉-默克尔的一位前经济顾问称，当克里斯蒂娜-拉加德的欧洲央行行长任期于 2027 年底结束时，德国将最终获得欧洲央行的最高职位。【原文：Germany should finally get the top job at the European Central Bank when Christine Lagarde’s term as president ends in late 2027, according to a former economic adviser to Chancellor Angela Merkel.】

item.title: 索迪斯预测 2026 年增长放缓后暴跌
item.description: 索迪斯公司（Sodexo SA）股价创下七个月来最大跌幅，此前这家法国餐饮公司预测，由于结构性挑战依然存在，特别是在美国高等教育领域，2026 年的收入增长将放缓。【原文：Sodexo SA shares tumbled the most in seven months after the French catering company predicted a slowdown in revenue growth in 2026 as structural challenges remain, particularly in US higher education.】

item.title: 内塔尼亚胡党斥责对手的吞并法案为 "戏弄
item.description: 以色列总理本雅明-内塔尼亚胡（Benjamin Netanyahu）的右翼竞争对手在议会一读中以微弱优势通过了一项兼并约旦河西岸的法案，这引起了美国的抗议，因为盟国正试图实施一项加沙和平计划，而该计划能否获得地区支持取决于是否承认巴勒斯坦的领土要求。【原文：Right-wing rivals of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu narrowly passed a West Bank annexation bill in a first parliamentary reading, drawing remonstration from the US as the allies try to implement a Gaza peace plan whose regional support hinges on acknowledging Palestinian territorial claims.】

item.title: 美国与猎户座组建关键矿产基金 目标 50 亿美元
item.description: 美国政府与 Orion Resource Partners 和阿布扎比的 ADQ 共同投资了一个新基金，用于投资关键矿产。【原文：The US government has invested in a new fund to invest in critical minerals alongside Orion Resource Partners and Abu Dhabi’s ADQ.】

item.title: Castellum 新任首席执行官称，情况在好转之前还会更糟
item.description: Castellum AB 的首席执行官 Pal Ahlsen 表示，市场形势严峻，空置率不断上升，情况可能会先恶化后好转。【原文：Castellum AB’s Chief Executive Officer Pal Ahlsen said it will probably get worse before it gets better, pointing to a tough market and increasing vacancy rates.】

item.title: 世界为何开始对冲美元风险
欧洲一级债券市场出现 6 月以来首笔撤单交易
item.description: 欧洲一级债务市场自今年夏天以来首次出现取消债券交易的情况，这也是全年创纪录交易中罕见的瑕疵。【原文：Europe’s primary debt market has just logged its first canceled bond deal since the summer — a rare blemish on what’s been a record-breaking run all year.】

item.title: 瑞士国家银行认为政策设置将适时刺激通胀
item.description: 瑞士国家银行官员上月决定不降息，他们认为瑞士的货币政策足以在未来几个季度刺激通胀。【原文：Swiss National Bank officials decided against an interest-rate cut last month, assessing their monetary stance to be stimulative enough to stoke inflation in coming quarters.】
